org.vertx.java.core.http

Class HttpServerRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vertx.java.core.http.impl.HttpReadStreamBase
      • org.vertx.java.core.http.HttpServerRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReadStream

    public abstract class HttpServerRequest
extends org.vertx.java.core.http.impl.HttpReadStreamBase
    Represents a server-side HTTP request.

    An instance of this class is created for each request that is handled by the server andis passed to the user via the Handler instance registered with the HttpServer using the method HttpServer.requestHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler).

    Each instance of this class is associated with a correspondin HttpServerResponse instance via the response field.

    Author:
    Tim Fox

    • Field Detail

      • method

        public final java.lang.String method
        The HTTP method for the request. One of GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, TRACE, CONNECT, OPTIONS, HEAD

      • uri

        public final java.lang.String uri
        The uri of the request. For example http://www.somedomain.com/somepath/somemorepath/somresource.foo?someparam=32&someotherparam=x

      • path

        public final java.lang.String path
        The path part of the uri. For example /somepath/somemorepath/somresource.foo

      • query

        public final java.lang.String query
        The query part of the uri. For example someparam=32&someotherparam=x

      • response

        public final HttpServerResponse response
        The response. Each instance of this class has an HttpServerResponse instance attached to it. This is used to send the response back to the client.

    • Method Detail

      • getHeader

        public abstract java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String key)
        Return the HTTP request header with the name key from this request, or null if there is no such header.

      • getHeaderNames

        public abstract java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getHeaderNames()
        Return a set of all the HTTP header names in this request

      • getAllHeaders

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllHeaders()
        Returns a map of all headers in the request, If the request contains multiple headers with the same key, the values will be concatenated together into a single header with the same key value, with each value separated by a comma, as specified here.

      • getAllParams

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllParams()
        Returns a map of all the parameters in the request

      • dataHandler

        public abstract void dataHandler(Handler<Buffer> dataHandler)
        Specify a data handler for the request. If the request has a body, the dataHandler will get called when some of the request body has been read from the wire. If the request is chunked, then it will be called once for each HTTP chunk, otherwise it will be called one or more times until the full request body has been received.

        If the request has no body it will not be called at all.

        Parameters:
        dataHandler -

      • exceptionHandler

        public abstract void exceptionHandler(Handler<java.lang.Exception> handler)
        Specify an exception handler for the request. The exceptionHandler is called if an exception occurs when handling the request.

      • pause

        public abstract void pause()
        Pause the request. Once the request has been paused, the system will stop reading any more chunks of the request from the wire until it is resumed.

        Pause is often used in conjunction with a Pump to pump data between streams and implement flow control.

      • resume

        public abstract void resume()
        Resume a paused request. The request will resume receiving chunks of the request body from the wire.

        Resume is often used in conjunction with a Pump to pump data between streams and implement flow control.

      • endHandler

        public abstract void endHandler(Handler<java.lang.Void> handler)
        Specify an end handler for the request. The endHandler is called once the entire request has been read.
